name: gropeld

comment: If any representation of a graph with vertices ` V ` and edges ` E ` is an element of an arbitrary class ` C ` , then the ordered pair ` <. V , E >. ` of the set of vertices and the set of edges (which is such a representation of a graph with vertices ` V ` and edges ` E ` ) is an element of this class ` C ` . (Contributed by AV, 11-Oct-2020.)
